lines.text: The big difference between people is not between the rich and the poor, the good and the evil. The biggest of all differences between people is between those who have had pleasure in love and those who haven't.

[to Nonnie]
Me... What about me?

[Parting words to Boss Finley]
You? You can go straight to hell!
I like you. You are a nice monster.
I had my picture on the cover of Life magazine! Woo-ha!
And at the same time I was... employing my other talent, lovemaking.
That may be the only talent you were ever truly meant for.

[to Chance Wayne, after referring to him as 'Prince']
I once had a dog called Prince. I had to butcher him to keep all the bitches in town from being violated.
Leroy, did you know this is Chance Wayne... the famous Hollywood and Broadway celebrity?
Really?
Sure. All bartenders become movie stars. Right, Chance?
Oh, well. What he's trying to say is that I had your job for too long.
Well, some more oxygen?
No. No, I must look hideous in it.
Oh, no, honey. You just look exotic. Yeah. Like a princess from Mars or a... big magnified insect.
This is pretty high-class pot. Where'd you get it?
You beautiful, stupid young man. That is not pot. It's hashish, Moroccan, and the finest.

[Parting words to Alexandra del Lago]
Princess, each of us has his own private hell to go to.

[Parting words to her father]
Papa, I'm never comin' into that house again.

[after looking at Chance Wayne, who seems quite proud of his looks]
Well, I may have done better... but God knows I have done worse.
You have an illusion of power, poppa!
I have power and that's no illusion.
A lot of folks say they like what I did but they don't like the way I did it.
It's okay, Princess.
George, George. You're the only grown man I know that still says "gee" and "golly" and "gosh."
Well, I'm not as sophisticated as you.
Oh, man. Don't you know only squares drink gin martinis with olives?
Did we spend the night together?
Oy, yes, ma'am. But I did not molest you.
Princess, just smoke.

[He's just observed Chance popping a pill]
What is that you just took?

[Indifferently]
A pill.
What kind of pill?
Oh, Benny. Benzedrine.
On prescription?
Yeah, sort of...

[Cynically]
A goofball makes the world keep its balance.
lovemaking.
